ygData.subject: Re: [EverQuest] Re: Hardware
ygData.msgSnippet: Cool! My brother has one of those cases with the light thingy that responds to sound. Unfortunately the computer doesn t work. It keeps rebooting itself for no
ygData.messageBody:
Cool!
My brother has one of those cases with the light thingy that responds to
sound.
Unfortunately the computer doesn't work. It keeps rebooting itself for no
reason. The microsoft error report thing said there was some driver conflict
causing it but we don't know what driver it is and it often reboots before
we can get far enough to tell. Well, that and my brother is not willing to
take the time to mess with it and expects me to fix it for him.
I know we had problems before and had to pay the computer shop we bought it
from to fix a problem but it turns out they were the reason the problem
exisited. One of their employees loaded software and drivers on it that were
causing it to not work before and I don't know if they left some of it or
what. Really frustrating.
luv,
-Su

> Heh heh not to brag or anything but I have no lag in the Bazaar..gotta
love
> DSL...I don't really remember the hardware stats on my PC but it has top
of
> the line stuff as of November 02 and I love it. My friend made it for me
> and it cost me just about $1600. I have 1Gigabyte of RAM and THX Surround
> Sound Speakers (I love the subwoofer) and my case is all black alliumun
> (excuse my spelling) and it has a blue light inside the see-thru case that
> is sound activated so whenever you make noise or play music it flashes.
The
> front of my case has this twin lava lamp sotra thing that goes from blue,
> green, and red. My mouse is see thru optical with a blue light and my
whole
> computer is all black and my moniter is a 15 inch flat screen. Heh I only
> got one of those cheap office chairs that has wheels and spins around but
it
> works for me. Well thats it, talk to you guys later!
>
> Happy Hunting!
>
> -----Original Message-----
